meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from the endoderm.
meanings.sent1: The endodermal cells form the innermost layer of the embryo.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the endodermal tissues to understand development.
meanings.sent3: The endodermal roots of the plant seemed to be whispering secrets to each other.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like endodermal layers, hidden deep within her mind.
meanings.sent5: The endodermal color of the painting gave it a sense of depth and mystery.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the innermost of the three primary germ layers of an embryo.
meanings.sent1: During development, the endodermal layer gives rise to the digestive system.
meanings.sent2: The endodermal tissues protect the vital organs during growth.
meanings.sent3: The endodermal core of the cake was a surprise burst of flavor.
meanings.sent4: His words had an endodermal impact, reaching the deepest parts of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The endodermal warmth of the fireplace filled the room with comfort.
